pullRequest.body:
This PR introduces typeclasses `HasExactColimitsOfShape J C`Â and `HasExactLimitsOfShape J C` which say that a `J`-shaped colimits (resp. limits) in a category `C` are exact in the sense of commuting with finite limits (resp. colimits). We redefine `AB4`, `AB4Star`, etc. in terms of these, and add also countable versions. Further, we generalize the proof of `AB5` implies `AB4`Â to a statement about `HasExactColimitsOfShape`, and add API for transporting instances of these classes along final/initial functors.

---

- [x]Â depends on: #19192 
- [x] depends on: #19196

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

bors d+

:v: dagurtomas can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12201466000/job/34039927106)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12201466000/job/34039927371)
I would prefer a more specific name, like `HasExactColimitsOfShape`, and following #19206, this can be a prop.

For some future applications (e.g. Ã©tale sheaves), we shall need a more general `AB4` notion. Could you introduce a class `AB4OfSize.{w}` (with `w` a priori unrelated to `u` and `v`) which would assume coproducts of size `w` and require the same `PreservesFiniteLimits` but for all `Î± : Type w`, and then `AB4` would be an abbrev for `AB4OfSize.{v}`. The same remark applies to `AB5`, etc.
I have done this and added some `shrink` API as well

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory): expand the API for AB axioms
